thread.title: After birth of son, Britain's Prince William waves to crowds

title: After birth of son, Britain's Prince William waves to crowds

organizations.name: lindo wing of st mary's hospital

text:
April 23, 2018 / 3:24 PM / Updated 29 minutes ago After birth of son, Britain's Prince William waves to crowds Reuters Staff 1 Min Read 
LONDON (Reuters) - Britain’s Prince William left the hospital where his son was born on Monday, waving to crowds and telling reporters: “I’ll be back in a minute.” Britain's Prince William leaves the Lindo Wing of St Mary's Hospital after his wife Catherine, the Duchess of Cambridge, gave birth to a son, in London, April 23, 2018. REUTERS/Hannah McKay 
Kate, the wife of Prince William, gave birth to a baby boy at 1001 GMT. William was present for the birth at St Mary’s Hospital in west London where their other two children, George and Charlotte, were also born, it added. Reporting by Hannah McKay; writing by by Guy Faulconbridge; editing by Michael Holden and Andy bruce
